decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

The proposed development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the materials detailed under Section titled 'Materials' of the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, the outbuilding hereby permitted shall be used only for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwelling house known as 124 Eastern Avenue East, Romford and not for any trade or business nor as living accommodation.
To restrict the use to one compatible with a residential area.
The existing screen fencing located on the boundaries adjoining nos.122 Eastern Avenue East and 22 Fairoak Gardens shall be permanently retained and maintained.
In the interests of the amenity of the occupiers of neighbouring dwelling, and in order that the development accords with Policy 7 of the Local Plan 2021.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent via email and phone call on 25/04/2022. The revisions involved discrepancies in the elevations - front, rear and sides. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 27/04/2022.
